baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve a First Degree Murder?

yesResult.description: Murder (premeditated killing or death resulting from specified felonies)

noResult.description: This guideline does not apply - refer to appropriate guideline for the actual offense

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve a Second Degree Murder?

yesResult.description: Murder (premeditated killing or death resulting from specified felonies)

noResult.description: This guideline does not apply - refer to appropriate guideline for the actual offense

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve a Voluntary Manslaughter?

noResult.description: This guideline does not apply - refer to appropriate guideline for the actual offense

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve reckless conduct?

yesResult.description: Involuntary manslaughter with reckless conduct

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve criminally negligent conduct?

yesResult.description: Involuntary manslaughter with criminally negligent conduct

2A1.5.title: Conspiracy or Solicitation to Commit Murder

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is this a conspiracy or solicitation to commit murder offense under §2A1.5?

yesResult.description: Conspiracy or solicitation to commit murder

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the offer or receipt of anything of pecuniary value for undertaking the murder?

yesEffect.description: Offense involved offer or receipt of pecuniary value for undertaking the murder

2A2.1.title: Assault with Intent to Commit Murder; Attempted Murder

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Would the object of the offense have constituted first degree murder?

yesResult.description: Object of offense would have constituted first degree murder

noResult.description: Object of offense would not have constituted first degree murder

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What level of bodily injury did the victim sustain?

options.label: No permanent, life-threatening, or serious bodily injury

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the offer or receipt of anything of pecuniary value for undertaking the murder?

yesEffect.description: Murder for hire

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does this offense fall under §2A2.2?

yesResult.description: Base offense level for §2A2.2

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the assault involve more than minimal planning?

yesEffect.description: More than minimal planning

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What level of weapon involvement occurred?

options.label: Dangerous weapon (including firearm) brandished or use threatened

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What degree of bodily injury did the victim sustain?

options.label: Injury between Bodily and Serious Bodily
Injury between Serious Bodily and Permanent/Life-Threatening

specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Cumulative adjustments from (b)(2) and (b)(3) shall not exceed 10 levels

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve strangling, suffocating, or attempting to strangle or suffocate a spouse, intimate partner, or dating partner?

yesEffect.description: Domestic strangulation/suffocation

specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Cumulative adjustments from (b)(2), (b)(3), and (b)(4) shall not exceed 12 levels

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the assault motivated by a payment or offer of money or other thing of value?

yesEffect.description: Payment motivated assault

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the violation of a court protection order?

yesEffect.description: Violation of court protection order

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 111(b) or § 115?

yesEffect.description: Assault on federal officer or official

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the conduct constitute aggravated assault as defined in §2A2.2?

yesResult.description: Apply §2A2.2 (Aggravated Assault) per cross reference

noResult.description: Base offense level for obstructing or impeding officers

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the victim sustain bodily injury or did the offense result in substantial bodily injury to a spouse, intimate partner, dating partner, or individual under 16?

options.label: Substantial bodily injury to spouse, intimate partner, dating partner, or individual under 16

2A3.1.title: Criminal Sexual Abuse; Attempt to Commit Criminal Sexual Abuse

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 2241(c)?

yesResult.description: Conviction under 18 U.S.C. § 2241(c)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve conduct described in 18 U.S.C. § 2241(a) or (b)?

yesEffect.description: Conduct involving force, threats, rendering unconscious, or administering drugs

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: If subsection (a)(2) applies, what was the victim's age?

options.label: Victim had not attained the age of twelve years
Victim had attained the age of twelve but not sixteen years
Victim was sixteen years or older

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the victim in the custody, care, or supervisory control of the defendant, or held in custody of a correctional facility?

yesEffect.description: Victim in defendant's custody/care/control or correctional facility custody

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What degree of bodily injury did the victim sustain?

options.label: Degree of injury between serious and permanent/life-threatening

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the victim abducted?

yesEffect.description: Victim was abducted

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve knowing misrepresentation of identity or use of computer/interactive service to persuade/induce/entice/coerce a minor or facilitate transportation for prohibited sexual conduct?

yesEffect.description: Knowing misrepresentation of participant's identity or use of computer/interactive service

2A3.2.title: Criminal Sexual Abuse of a Minor Under the Age of Sixteen Years

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does this offense fall under §2A3.2?

yesResult.description: Base offense level for §2A3.2

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the minor in the custody, care, or supervisory control of the defendant?

yesEffect.description: Minor was in defendant's custody, care, or supervisory control

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve knowing misrepresentation of identity or undue influence to engage the minor in prohibited sexual conduct?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if subsection (b)(1) does not apply

yesEffect.description: Knowing misrepresentation of participant's identity or undue influence to engage minor in prohibited sexual conduct

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was a computer or interactive computer service used to persuade, induce, entice, or coerce the minor to engage in prohibited sexual conduct?

yesEffect.description: Computer or interactive computer service used to persuade, induce, entice, or coerce minor

2A3.4.title: Abusive Sexual Contact or Attempt to Commit Abusive Sexual Contact

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve conduct described in 18 U.S.C. § 2241(a) (aggravated sexual abuse by force, threat, or other means, or aggravated sexual abuse of a child)?

yesResult.description: Offense involved conduct under 18 U.S.C. § 2241(a)

noResult.description: No applicable base offense level specified for other conduct

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Had the victim not attained the age of twelve years?

yesEffect.description: Victim under 12 years old

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Had the victim attained the age of twelve years but had not attained the age of sixteen years?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Base offense level is determined under subsection (a)(1) or (2)

yesEffect.description: Victim between 12 and 15 years old

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the victim in the custody, care, or supervisory control of the defendant?

yesEffect.description: Victim in defendant's custody, care, or supervisory control

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the knowing misrepresentation of a participant's identity to persuade, induce, entice, or coerce a minor to engage in prohibited sexual conduct?

yesEffect.description: Knowing misrepresentation of participant's identity

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was a computer or an interactive computer service used to persuade, induce, entice, or coerce a minor to engage in prohibited sexual conduct?

yesEffect.description: Use of computer or interactive computer service

2A3.5.title: Failure to Register as a Sex Offender

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant required to register as a Tier III offender?

yesResult.description: Tier III offender registration required

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant required to register as a Tier II offender?

yesResult.description: Tier II offender registration required

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant required to register as a Tier I offender?

yesResult.description: Tier I offender registration required

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant commit an offense while in a failure to register status?

options.label: Sex offense against someone other than a minor
Felony offense against a minor (not sex offense)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant voluntarily correct the failure to register or attempt to register but was prevented by uncontrollable circumstances?

yesEffect.description: Voluntary correction or prevented by uncontrollable circumstances not contributed to by defendant

2A3.6.title: Aggravated Offenses Relating to Registration as a Sex Offender

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the offense under 18 U.S.C. § 2260A?

yesResult.description: 10 years imprisonment as required by statute, imposed consecutively to any sentence for enumerated offenses

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the offense under 18 U.S.C. § 2250(d)?

yesResult.description: Minimum 5 years imprisonment (maximum 30 years) as required by statute, imposed consecutively to any sentence under § 2250(a) or (b)

noResult.description: Offense not covered by this guideline - only applies to 18 U.S.C. §§ 2250(d) and 2260A

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Under which statute was the defendant convicted?

options.label: 18 U.S.C. § 2250(d)
options.description: Guideline sentence is the minimum term of imprisonment required by statute

options.label: 18 U.S.C. § 2260A
options.description: Guideline sentence is the term of imprisonment required by statute

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is this offense covered under §2A4.1?

yesResult.description: Base offense level for §2A4.1

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was a ransom demand or demand upon government made?

yesEffect.description: Ransom demand or demand upon government was made

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What level of bodily injury did the victim sustain?
Was a dangerous weapon used?

yesEffect.description: Dangerous weapon was used

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: When was the victim released?

options.label: Not released before seven days elapsed
Not released before thirty days elapsed

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the victim sexually exploited?

yesEffect.description: Victim was sexually exploited

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the victim a minor placed in care/custody of another in exchange for money or consideration?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Victim is a minor and was placed in care/custody of person with no legal right

yesEffect.description: Minor victim placed in care/custody for money or consideration

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the kidnapping connected with another offense?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Kidnapping occurred during commission of/connection with another offense, or another offense was committed during kidnapping

yesEffect.description: Apply cross-reference calculation: Use higher of (A) offense level from other offense guideline if it accounts for kidnapping, or (B) 4 plus offense level from other offense guideline (max level 43)

2A5.2.title: Interference with Flight Crew Member or Flight Attendant; Interference with

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does this case involve an offense covered by §2A5.2?

yesResult.description: Base offense level for §2A5.2

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: If subsection (a)(1) or (a)(2) applies, what level of weapon involvement occurred?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if subsection (a)(1) or (a)(2) applies (intentionally or recklessly endangering safety)

options.label: A dangerous weapon was brandished or its use was threatened
A dangerous weapon was otherwise used

2A6.1.title: Threatening or Harassing Communications; Hoaxes; False Liens

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the defendant convicted of an offense under 47 U.S.C. § 223(a)(1)(C), (D), or (E) that did not involve a threat to injure a person or property?

yesResult.description: Offense under 47 U.S.C. § 223(a)(1)(C), (D), or (E) without threat to injure person or property

noResult.description: All other threatening or harassing communications, hoaxes, or false liens offenses

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve any conduct evidencing an intent to carry out the threat?

yesEffect.description: Conduct evidencing intent to carry out threat

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve more than two threats, or (if convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1521) more than two false liens or encumbrances?

yesEffect.description: More than two threats or false liens/encumbrances

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the violation of a court protection order?

yesEffect.description: Violation of court protection order

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense result in substantial disruption of public, governmental, or business functions/services, or substantial expenditure of funds to respond to the offense?

yesEffect.description: Substantial disruption or expenditure of funds

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Is the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 115, made a public threatening communication, and knew or should have known it created substantial risk of inciting others to violate 18 U.S.C. § 115?

yesEffect.description: Public threatening communication with risk of inciting others

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Does the offense qualify for the minimal deliberation reduction?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if subsection (a)(2) and subdivisions (1), (2), (3), (4), and (5) do not apply, and the offense involved a single instance evidencing little or no deliberation

yesEffect.description: Single instance with little or no deliberation

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve the commission of another criminal offense that would be covered by a Chapter Two, Part A (Offenses Against the Person) guideline with a resulting offense level greater than what would be determined under this guideline?

yesResult.description: Apply the offense guideline from Chapter Two, Part A most applicable to the other criminal offense

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve more than one of the following aggravating factors: (A) violation of a court protection order, (B) bodily injury, (C) strangling/suffocating/attempting to strangle or suffocate, (D) possession or threatened use of a dangerous weapon, or (E) a pattern of activity involving stalking, threatening, harassing, or assaulting the same victim?

yesResult.description: Base offense level 18, plus 4-level increase for multiple aggravating factors

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve exactly one of the following aggravating factors: (A) violation of a court protection order, (B) bodily injury, (C) strangling/suffocating/attempting to strangle or suffocate, (D) possession or threatened use of a dangerous weapon, or (E) a pattern of activity involving stalking, threatening, harassing, or assaulting the same victim?

yesResult.description: Base offense level 18, plus 2-level increase for one aggravating factor

noResult.description: Base offense level with no aggravating factors

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: How many of the following aggravating factors were present: (A) violation of a court protection order; (B) bodily injury; (C) strangling, suffocating, or attempting to strangle or suffocate; (D) possession, or threatened use, of a dangerous weapon; or (E) a pattern of activity involving stalking, threatening, harassing, or assaulting the same victim?
